info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 2:36PM MDT until July 18 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 236 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park, specifically Capitol Gorge, Arch Nemesis Canyon, Pleasant Creek, and Burro Wash. A National Park Ranger reported 6 to 8 inches of water is already flowing through Capitol Gorge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
